action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

A beetle with a shell of golden hue. Living in the deep caverns and often found in small groups. These groups often live on veins of gold, or if one isn't accessible or safe for the beetles, will form a false vein of gold with multiple Golden Beetles.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: Golden Beetle has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in a gold vein, or among five other Golden Beetles.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Crystal Wasp has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if there is another Crystal Wasp within 5 feet of the creature.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: Crystal Wasp has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in among crystals.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The Crystal Wasp Swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Crystal Wasp Swarm. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While Crystal Moss remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from other moss.

action.name: Slumbering Cloud
entries: A 15-foot radius of light blue gas extends out from the Crystal Moss. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a {@dc 11} saving throw or be {@condition Unconscious} for 1 minute.

action.name: Consume
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. If this attack is on a {@condition Unconscious} creature, it is not woken.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the veiled bandit to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to dark caves and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the veiled bandit to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to dark caves and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flintlock [Optional]
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow [If doesn't have a Flintlock]
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the veiled bandit to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to dark caves and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the veiled bandit assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the veiled bandit assassin scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the Veiled Bandit Assassin deals an extra 6 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Veiled Bandit Assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Veiled Bandit Assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Veiled Bandit Assassin makes three dagger attacks. Only one of the three attacks can be a throwing attack.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the veiled bandit to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The veiled bandit has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

trait.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to dark caves and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Spellcasting
entries: Veiled Bandit Mage is {level} level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (Spell Save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.
